newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-GASCOIGNE SAYS HE WILL BE FIT FOR ITALY GAME.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-GASCOIGNE SAYS HE WILL BE FIT FOR ITALY GAME.

text.p: England midfielder Paul Gascoigne, injured in a six-a-side tournament in Amsterdam on Monday, expects to be fit for the crucial World Cup qualifier against Italy at Wembley on February 12.
"I've spoken to Glenn (Hoddle) and told him I will be ready for the England match, there's no doubt about it," Gascoigne told Sky TV on Wednesday.
"I really panicked when I got hurt. But thank God everything is okay."
Gascoigne hurt an ankle when he collided with Ajax Amsterdam goalkeeper Fred Grim during Glasgow Rangers's first match in the "Euro 6ixs" tournament.
England coach Hoddle names his squad for the Italy clash on Thursday.
